subject: 2019-2020 PILOT ELITE CRACKLE/POPPING NOISE FROM SPEAKERS *RE-ROUTE HARNESS*
search_snippet: 12-3-2019 I HAVE A 2020 PILOT ELITE IN THE SHOP WITH SIMILAR CONCERN. SHUT DOWN REASONS ARE FOR THE REAR INFORTAINMENT UNIT AND OPTICAL DISC. SPOKE WITH TECHLINE, WAS INFORMED THEY HAVE BOUGHT BACK 3 VEHICLES WITH THE SPEAKERS CRACKLING AND INFOTAINMENT/RES SHUTTING DOWN CONCERN. W...
body:
12-3-2019

I HAVE A 2020 PILOT ELITE IN THE SHOP WITH SIMILAR CONCERN. SHUT DOWN REASONS ARE FOR THE REAR INFORTAINMENT UNIT AND OPTICAL DISC. SPOKE WITH TECHLINE, WAS INFORMED THEY HAVE BOUGHT BACK 3 VEHICLES WITH THE SPEAKERS CRACKLING AND INFOTAINMENT/RES SHUTTING DOWN CONCERN.

WITH HONDA ENGINEERS AND ENGINEERS FROM THE OHIO FACTORY PRESENT, UPON INSPECTION AND TEAR DOWN OF VEHICLES THEY FOUND THAT THE DASH HARNESS WAS IMPROPERLY ROUTED FROM FACTORY. WHEN TIGHTENING DOWN THE TWO BRACKET BOLTS FOR THE BLU RAY PLAYER, IT CAUSES STRESS/TENSION ON THE HARNESS. SPECIFICALLY THE FAKRA CONNECTORS ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE BLU RAY PLAYER. IT ISN'T BREAKING THEM OR COMPLETELY DISCONNECTING THEM, BUT PUTTING ENOUGH TENSION ON THEM THAT IN THE RIGHT CONDITIONS WILL CAUSE INTERMITTENT CONNECTION ISSUES.

WAS INFORMED THAT WHEN BLU-RAY PLAYER IS REMOVED CONNECTORS LOOK OK, BUT ONCE RE-INSTALLED THATS WHEN THE CONNECTION IS COMPROMISED.

I WAS TOLD THAT YES, REPLACING THE DASH HARNESS CAN FIX THE ISSUE BUT THEY BELIEVE IT'S MORE IN THE ROUTING OF THE DASH HARNESS THAN IT IS THE PART ITSELF. THE HARNESSES THEY HAVE RECEIVED BACK WERE CHECKED AND FOUND NOTHING WRONG WITH THEM.

SO AT THIS TIME, I WILL BE RE-ROUTING THE BLU-RAY PORTION OF THE DASH HARNESS PER TECHLINE.

THE BLU-RAY PORTION OF THE HARNESS ON THE VEHICLE I AM WORKING ON, GOES OVER A CROSS BAR SECTION OF THE DASH BRACKET. WAS INFORMED TO RE-ROUTE IT UNDER THE CROSS BAR SECTION SO THAT WHEN BLU RAY PLAYER BRACKET IS RE-INSTALLED, IT WON'T/SHOULDN'T PUT STRESS ON THE FAKRA CONNECTORS. ALSO TOLD TO CHECK HARNESS ROUTING OF RES CONTROL UNIT AND RELIEVE ANY STRESS POINTS FOUND.

I WILL UPLOAD PICTURES AS SOON AS I CAN. WILL TEST DRIVE AFTER RE-ROUTING OF HARNESS AND UPDATE.

 

**THIS MAY ONLY APPLY TO CERTAIN CONCERNS AND CONDITIONS. I HAVE READ SIMILAR FORUM POSTS ABOUT REPLACING FLOOR HARNESSES AND OTHER COMPONENTS. DON'T WANT TO SAY THIS WILL FIX ALL THE PROBLEMS. COULD ONLY PERTAIN TO CONDITIONS WITH RES AND BLU-RAY SHUT DOWN REASONS**

subject: 2019 pilot crackling voice from navi
search_snippet: ...he car was a complaint of crackling/distorted voice response from the navi.  I tested it out, tried to get directions to my dealership from the same parking lot.  Normally it would say something along the lines of "proceed to highlighted location to start route."  Only half of this w...
body:
This is something for a few weeks ago.  I have been waiting to see if it stayed fixed before posting about it.  I inherited this problem vehicle from another tech so I am not positive of all the details, I just know that it was very problematic before I got involved.

 

My part in the car was a complaint of crackling/distorted voice response from the navi.  I tested it out, tried to get directions to my dealership from the same parking lot.  Normally it would say something along the lines of "proceed to highlighted location to start route."  Only half of this was actually played and then it crackled loudly and went silent.  This particular model appears to use ONLY the center dash speaker for the navi's response.  I tested the resistance of the center speaker and got double the resistance printed on the unit.  Memory is foggy I think it was a 2 ohm speaker, but regardless it was double what was specified.

 

Just sharing this so others might have a direction if they see this.  Also wondering if this might be causing any of the popping crackling issues we are seeing in some cars.  I imagine a wildly wrong resistance value will put an amp into circuit protection and might be have some noises along the way, this one certainly did.

subject: 2018-21 Odyssey: Popping or Crackling from the Speakers; No Sound from the Audio System; Network Loss Message and/or Display Issues (Revised 10/12/2020)

@Tom_H  
 Folks, the 20-049 tsb for connector/jumper MOST fix currently does not support claim info for 2021 models, however the fix is the same. Use the the labor and applicable part #s to do the job. An updated tsb should be released soon. TechLine will chime in here if there is more info to...
body:
@Tom_H 

Folks, the 20-049 tsb for connector/jumper MOST fix currently does not support claim info for 2021 models, however the fix is the same. Use the the labor and applicable part #s to do the job. An updated tsb should be released soon. TechLine will chime in here if there is more info to be added.

subject: Popping or Crackling from the Speakers; No Sound from the Audio System; Network Loss Message and/or Display Issues (Revised 09/10/2020)
2020 pilot touring, crackling/ pop noise
search_snippet: I have a 2020 Pilot Touring with a crackling/ pop noise at all times. I have photos of the most network connectors. re-arranged the audio connectors and it seems that the noise is gone. Found no loose connections. Will update if anything changes. Let me know if there is anything else I should do. T...
body: I have a 2020 Pilot Touring with a crackling/ pop noise at all times. I have photos of the most network connectors. re-arranged the audio connectors and it seems that the noise is gone. Found no loose connections. Will update if anything changes. Let me know if there is anything else I should do. Thank you!

subject: Speaker crackling and popping
search_snippet: Thought I would post what I've been doing on MOST network issues and harness reroutes. Here are a few pics that seem to be fixing the speaker pop and crackling/audio issues. I very carefully cut back the harness loom to separate the MOST wires from the main harness then retape main harness. This a...
body: Thought I would post what I've been doing on MOST network issues and harness reroutes. Here are a few pics that seem to be fixing the speaker pop and crackling/audio issues. I very carefully cut back the harness loom to separate the MOST wires from the main harness then retape main harness. This allows the MOST connectors to have no bends and a nice straight connection while not being influenced by the main harness.

subject: 2020 Odyssey intermittent crackle/snap noise from front tweeters
search_snippet: I have a 2020 Odyssey EX with and intermitent crackle/snap noise coming from the front tweeters. Noise doesnt seem to be triggered by anything in particular, only seems to be coming from the front tweeters. i did not hear it from any other speakers. I test drove with customer. noise happens r...
body: I have a 2020 Odyssey EX with and intermitent crackle/snap noise coming from the front tweeters. Noise doesnt seem to be triggered by anything in particular, only seems to be coming from the front tweeters. i did not hear it from any other speakers. I test drove with customer. noise happens regardless of whats on the infotainment. Happens in AM, FM, Sirius, and customer states is has also happened on phone calls. even happens with radio off. Shutdown  reason has no information stored at all, and ECL diag confirms everythig is normal. Customer does have a slightly frayed iphone cord plugged in, but there was no changed when unplugging. just curios if anybody else has come across this issue. Any input is greatly appreciated.

subject: Popping or Crackling from the Speakers? Check the MOST Bus Network (Revised 04/21/2020)
2019 Pilot Elite crackle/popping noise from speakers
search_snippet: I currently have two vehicles with crackle/popping from the speakers. I spoke with techline previously and they are having me relax the harness by removing tie down clips. During this procedure, I found a cut wire behind the infotainment with no apparent connector.
body: I currently have two vehicles with crackle/popping from the speakers. I spoke with techline previously and they are having me relax the harness by removing tie down clips. During this procedure, I found a cut wire behind the infotainment with no apparent connector.
